page.title: 01Leisure Pursuits
page.content: I surveyed 46 people in Lea School to see how they spent their leisure time during the course of a typical week. These are the results; 266 hours was spent watching television, 56 hours was spent playing football. 4 hours was spent swimming. 2 hours was spent playing rounders. 5 hours was spent playing tennis, some of this at the local sports centre. 1 hour was spent playing cricket, 63 hours playing games and programing on personal computers. 8 hours was spent playing snooker, 1 hour was spent playing tabletennis and 4 hours was spent practicing ballet. 7 hours was spent on the piano, 9 hours was spent at brownies and 5 hours at cubs and scouts. 15 hours was spent at gymnastics, 49 hours was spent playing out with friends and 11 hours spent roller skating.
